+      "diff": "diff --git a/src/experimental/DeveloperMoodTracker.js b/src/experimental/DeveloperMoodTracker.js\nnew file mode 100644\nindex 0000000..a70f811\n--- /dev/null\n+++ b/src/experimental/DeveloperMoodTracker.js\n@@ -0,0 +1,141 @@\n+/**\n+ * Developer Mood Tracker - Experimental Feature\n+ * Tracks developer mood based on commit patterns and code quality\n+ */\n+\n+class DeveloperMoodTracker {\n+  constructor() {\n+    this.moods = ['😴', '😤', '🤔', '😊', '🚀', '🔥'];\n+    this.moodHistory = [];\n+  }\n+\n+  /**\n+   * Analyze developer mood based on commit message and code changes\n+   * @param {string} commitMessage - The commit message\n+   * @param {number} linesChanged - Number of lines changed\n+   * @param {number} filesChanged - Number of files changed\n+   * @returns {string} Mood emoji\n+   */\n+  analyzeMood(commitMessage, linesChanged = 0, filesChanged = 0) {\n+    let moodScore = 3; // Default neutral mood\n+\n+    // Analyze commit message sentiment\n+    if (commitMessage.includes('fix') || commitMessage.includes('bug')) {\n+      moodScore -= 1; // Frustrated\n+    }\n+    if (commitMessage.includes('feat') || commitMessage.includes('add')) {\n+      moodScore += 1; // Happy\n+    }\n+    if (commitMessage.includes('refactor') || commitMessage.includes('clean')) {\n+      moodScore += 2; // Very productive\n+    }\n+    if (commitMessage.includes('WIP') || commitMessage.includes('temp')) {\n+      moodScore -= 2; // Tired/rushed\n+    }\n+\n+    // Factor in code changes\n+    if (linesChanged > 500) moodScore += 1; // Productive day\n+    if (filesChanged > 10) moodScore += 1; // Big feature work\n+\n+    // Clamp mood score\n+    moodScore = Math.max(0, Math.min(5, moodScore));\n+    \n+    const mood = this.moods[moodScore];\n+    this.recordMood(mood, commitMessage);\n+    \n+    return mood;\n+  }\n+\n+  /**\n+   * Record mood in history\n+   * @param {string} mood - Mood emoji\n+   * @param {string} context - Context (commit message)\n+   */\n+  recordMood(mood, context) {\n+    this.moodHistory.push({\n+      mood,\n+      context,\n+      timestamp: new Date().toISOString()\n+    });\n+\n+    // Keep only last 10 entries\n+    if (this.moodHistory.length > 10) {\n+      this.moodHistory.shift();\n+    }\n+  }\n+\n+  /**\n+   * Get current developer mood trend\n+   * @returns {object} Mood analysis\n+   */\n+  getMoodTrend() {\n+    if (this.moodHistory.length === 0) {\n+      return { trend: 'neutral', message: 'No mood data yet!' };\n+    }\n+\n+    const recentMoods = this.moodHistory.slice(-5);\n+    const moodCounts = {};\n+    \n+    recentMoods.forEach(entry => {\n+      moodCounts[entry.mood] = (moodCounts[entry.mood] || 0) + 1;\n+    });\n+\n+    const dominantMood = Object.keys(moodCounts).reduce((a, b) => \n+      moodCounts[a] > moodCounts[b] ? a : b\n+    );\n+\n+    const messages = {\n+      '😴': 'Time for coffee! You seem tired.',\n+      '😤': 'Lots of bug fixes lately. Hang in there!',\n+      '🤔': 'Deep thinking mode activated.',\n+      '😊': 'Good vibes! Keep up the great work.',\n+      '🚀': 'You\\'re on fire! Productivity through the roof!',\n+      '🔥': 'Absolute legend status achieved!'\n+    };\n+\n+    return {\n+      trend: dominantMood,\n+      message: messages[dominantMood] || 'Keep coding!',\n+      history: this.moodHistory\n+    };\n+  }\n+\n+  /**\n+   * Generate mood report for team standup\n+   * @returns {string} Formatted mood report\n+   */\n+  generateMoodReport() {\n+    const trend = this.getMoodTrend();\n+    const totalCommits = this.moodHistory.length;\n+    \n+    return `\n+🎯 Developer Mood Report\n+========================\n+Current Trend: ${trend.trend} ${trend.message}\n+Total Tracked Commits: ${totalCommits}\n+Recent Activity: ${this.moodHistory.slice(-3).map(h => h.mood).join(' ')}\n+\n+💡 Tip: ${this.getProductivityTip(trend.trend)}\n+    `.trim();\n+  }\n+\n+  /**\n+   * Get productivity tip based on mood\n+   * @param {string} mood - Current mood emoji\n+   * @returns {string} Productivity tip\n+   */\n+  getProductivityTip(mood) {\n+    const tips = {\n+      '😴': 'Take a break! Fresh air and coffee work wonders.',\n+      '😤': 'Consider pair programming for tough bugs.',\n+      '🤔': 'Document your thought process - future you will thank you!',\n+      '😊': 'Great momentum! Maybe tackle that refactoring task?',\n+      '🚀': 'Perfect time to mentor a junior developer!',\n+      '🔥': 'Share your success with the team - inspire others!'\n+    };\n+    \n+    return tips[mood] || 'Keep being awesome!';\n+  }\n+}\n+\n+module.exports = DeveloperMoodTracker;\n\\ No newline at end of file",

+      "title": "feat(experimental): Add DeveloperMoodTracker to monitor developer mood",
+      "body": "This PR introduces an experimental feature called `DeveloperMoodTracker`. This class analyzes commit messages and code changes to gauge developer mood and provide insights into team productivity.\n\n**Functionality:**\n\n* **Mood Analysis:** Analyzes commit messages for keywords (e.g., 'fix', 'feat', 'refactor') and code changes (lines and files changed) to assign a mood emoji (😴, 😤, 🤔, 😊, 🚀, 🔥).\n* **Mood History:** Maintains a history of moods with timestamps and commit contexts for trend analysis.\n* **Mood Trend:** Calculates the dominant mood over the last 5 commits.\n* **Mood Report:** Generates a summary report for team standups, including current mood trend, total commits, recent activity, and a productivity tip.\n\n**How it works:**\n\nThe `analyzeMood` function assesses sentiment from the commit message and the number of lines/files changed.  This score is then used to assign a mood emoji and stored in the mood history. The `getMoodTrend` function analyzes the recent mood history to identify the current mood. The `generateMoodReport` function provides a neatly formatted summary of this data.\n\n**Example Usage:**\n\njavascript\nconst tracker = new DeveloperMoodTracker();\nconst mood = tracker.analyzeMood('Fix: Resolved critical bug', 150, 3);\nconsole.log(mood); // Might output 😤\nconsole.log(tracker.generateMoodReport());\n\n\nThis feature is experimental and can be further improved with more sophisticated sentiment analysis and potentially integration with other metrics.",

+        "title": "feat(experimental): Add DeveloperMoodTracker to monitor developer mood",
+        "user": {
+          "login": "ManagementMO",
+          "id": 111318013,
+          "node_id": "U_kgDOBqKT_Q",
+          "avatar_url": "https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/111318013?v=4",

+          "url": "https://api.github.com/users/ManagementMO",
+          "html_url": "https://github.com/ManagementMO",

+          "site_admin": false
+        },
+        "body": "This PR introduces an experimental feature called `DeveloperMoodTracker`. This class analyzes commit messages and code changes to gauge developer mood and provide insights into team productivity.\n\n**Functionality:**\n\n* **Mood Analysis:** Analyzes commit messages for keywords (e.g., 'fix', 'feat', 'refactor') and code changes (lines and files changed) to assign a mood emoji (😴, 😤, 🤔, 😊, 🚀, 🔥).\n* **Mood History:** Maintains a history of moods with timestamps and commit contexts for trend analysis.\n* **Mood Trend:** Calculates the dominant mood over the last 5 commits.\n* **Mood Report:** Generates a summary report for team standups, including current mood trend, total commits, recent activity, and a productivity tip.\n\n**How it works:**\n\nThe `analyzeMood` function assesses sentiment from the commit message and the number of lines/files changed.  This score is then used to assign a mood emoji and stored in the mood history. The `getMoodTrend` function analyzes the recent mood history to identify the current mood. The `generateMoodReport` function provides a neatly formatted summary of this data.\n\n**Example Usage:**\n\njavascript\nconst tracker = new DeveloperMoodTracker();\nconst mood = tracker.analyzeMood('Fix: Resolved critical bug', 150, 3);\nconsole.log(mood); // Might output 😤\nconsole.log(tracker.generateMoodReport());\n\n\nThis feature is experimental and can be further improved with more sophisticated sentiment analysis and potentially integration with other metrics.",

// Default neutral mood\\n+\\n+    // Analyze commit message sentiment\\n+    if (commitMessage.includes('fix') || commitMessage.includes('bug')) {\\n+      moodScore -= 1; // Frustrated\\n+    }\\n+    if (commitMessage.includes('feat') || commitMessage.includes('add')) {\\n+      moodScore += 1; // Happy\\n+    }\\n+    if (commitMessage.includes('refactor') || commitMessage.includes('clean')) {\\n+      moodScore += 2; // Very productive\\n+    }\\n+    if (commitMessage.includes('WIP') || commitMessage.includes('temp')) {\\n+      moodScore -= 2; // Tired/rushed\\n+    }\\n+\\n+    // Factor in code changes\\n+    if (linesChanged > 500) moodScore += 1; // Productive day\\n+    if (filesChanged > 10) moodScore += 1; // Big feature work\\n+\\n+    // Clamp mood score\\n+    moodScore = Math.max(0, Math.min(5, moodScore));\\n+    \\n+    const mood = this.moods[moodScore];\\n+    this.recordMood(mood, commitMessage);\\n+    \\n+    return mood;\\n+  }\\n+\\n+  /**\\n+   * Record mood in history\\n+   * @param {string} mood - Mood emoji\\n+   * @param {string} context - Context (commit message)\\n+   */\\n+  recordMood(mood, context) {\\n+    this.moodHistory.push({\\n+      mood,\\n+      context,\\n+      timestamp: new Date().toISOString()\\n+    });\\n+\\n+    // Keep only last 10 entries\\n+    if (this.moodHistory.length > 10) {\\n+      this.moodHistory.shift();\\n+    }\\n+  }\\n+\\n+  /**\\n+   * Get current developer mood trend\\n+   * @returns {object} Mood analysis\\n+   */\\n+  getMoodTrend() {\\n+    if (this.moodHistory.length === 0) {\\n+      return { trend: 'neutral', message: 'No mood data yet!' };\\n+    }\\n+\\n+    const recentMoods = this.moodHistory.slice(-5);\\n+    const moodCounts = {};\\n+    \\n+    recentMoods.forEach(entry => {\\n+      moodCounts[entry.mood] = (moodCounts[entry.mood] || 0) + 1;\\n+    });\\n+\\n+    const dominantMood = Object.keys(moodCounts).reduce((a, b) => \\n+      moodCounts[a] > moodCounts[b] ? a : b\\n+    );\\n+\\n+    const messages = {\\n+      '😴': 'Time for coffee! You seem tired.',\\n+      '😤': 'Lots of bug fixes lately. Hang in there!',\\n+      '🤔': 'Deep thinking mode activated.',\\n+      '😊': 'Good vibes! Keep up the great work.',\\n+      '🚀': 'You\\\\'re on fire! Productivity through the roof!',\\n+      '🔥': 'Absolute legend status achieved!'\\n+    };\\n+\\n+    return {\\n+      trend: dominantMood,\\n+      message: messages[dominantMood] || 'Keep coding!',\\n+      history: this.moodHistory\\n+    };\\n+  }\\n+\\n+  /**\\n+   * Generate mood report for team standup\\n+   * @returns {string} Formatted mood report\\n+   */\\n+  generateMoodReport() {\\n+    const trend = this.getMoodTrend();\\n+    const totalCommits = this.moodHistory.length;\\n+    \\n+    return `\\n+🎯 Developer Mood Report\\n+========================\\n+Current Trend: ${trend.trend} ${trend.message}\\n+Total Tracked Commits: ${totalCommits}\\n+Recent Activity: ${this.moodHistory.slice(-3).map(h => h.mood).join(' ')}\\n+\\n+💡 Tip: ${this.getProductivityTip(trend.trend)}\\n+    `.trim();\\n+  }\\n+\\n+  /**\\n+   * Get productivity tip based on mood\\n+   * @param {string} mood - Current mood emoji\\n+   * @returns {string} Productivity tip\\n+   */\\n+  getProductivityTip(mood) {\\n+    const tips = {\\n+      '😴': 'Take a break! Fresh air and coffee work wonders.',\\n+      '😤': 'Consider pair programming for tough bugs.',\\n+      '🤔': 'Document your thought process - future you will thank you!',\\n+      '😊': 'Great momentum! Maybe tackle that refactoring task?',\\n+      '🚀': 'Perfect time to mentor a junior developer!',\\n+      '🔥': 'Share your success with the team - inspire others!'\\n+    };\\n+    \\n+    return tips[mood] || 'Keep being awesome!';\\n+  }\\n+}\\n+\\n+module.exports = DeveloperMoodTracker;\\n\\\\ No newline at end of file\",\n+      \"diffStats\": \"src/experimental/DeveloperMoodTracker.js | `DeveloperMoodTracker`. This class analyzes commit messages and code changes to gauge developer mood and provide insights into team productivity.\\n\\n**Functionality:**\\n\\n* **Mood Analysis:** Analyzes commit messages for keywords (e.g., 'fix', 'feat', 'refactor') and code changes (lines and files changed) to assign a mood emoji (😴, 😤, 🤔, 😊, 🚀, 🔥).\\n* **Mood History:** Maintains a history of moods with timestamps and commit contexts for trend analysis.\\n* **Mood Trend:** Calculates the dominant mood over the last 5 commits.\\n* **Mood Report:** Generates a summary report for team standups, including current mood trend, total commits, recent activity, and a productivity tip.\\n\\n**How it works:**\\n\\nThe `analyzeMood` function assesses sentiment from the commit message and the number of lines/files changed.  This score is then used to assign a mood emoji and stored in the mood history. The `getMoodTrend` function analyzes the recent mood history to identify the current mood. The `generateMoodReport` function provides a neatly formatted summary of this data.\\n\\n**Example Usage:**\\n\\njavascript\\nconst tracker = new DeveloperMoodTracker();\\nconst mood = tracker.analyzeMood('Fix: Resolved critical bug', 150, 3);\\nconsole.log(mood); // Might output 😤\\nconsole.log(tracker.generateMoodReport());\\n\\n\\nThis feature is experimental and can be further improved with more sophisticated sentiment analysis and potentially integration with other metrics.\",\n+      \"summary\": \"Adds an experimental feature to track developer mood based on commit \"body\": \"This PR introduces an experimental feature called `DeveloperMoodTracker`. This class analyzes commit messages and code changes to gauge developer mood and provide insights into team productivity.\\n\\n**Functionality:**\\n\\n* **Mood Analysis:** Analyzes commit messages for keywords (e.g., 'fix', 'feat', 'refactor') and code changes (lines and files changed) to assign a mood emoji (😴, 😤, 🤔, 😊, 🚀, 🔥).\\n* **Mood History:** Maintains a history of moods with timestamps and commit contexts for trend analysis.\\n* **Mood Trend:** Calculates the dominant mood over the last 5 commits.\\n* **Mood Report:** Generates a summary report for team standups, including current mood trend, total commits, recent activity, and a productivity tip.\\n\\n**How it works:**\\n\\nThe `analyzeMood` function assesses sentiment from the commit message and the number of lines/files changed.  This score is then used to assign a mood emoji and stored in the mood history. The `getMoodTrend` function analyzes the recent mood history to identify the current mood. The `generateMoodReport` function provides a neatly formatted summary of this data.\\n\\n**Example Usage:**\\n\\njavascript\\nconst tracker = new DeveloperMoodTracker();\\nconst mood = tracker.analyzeMood('Fix: Resolved critical bug', 150, 3);\\nconsole.log(mood); // Might output 😤\\nconsole.log(tracker.generateMoodReport());\\n\\n\\nThis feature is experimental and can be further improved with more sophisticated sentiment analysis and potentially integration with other metrics.\",\n+        \"created_at\": \"2025-07-20T13:19:20Z\",\n+        \"updated_at\": \"body\": \"This PR introduces an experimental feature called `DeveloperMoodTracker`. This class analyzes commit messages and code changes to gauge developer mood and provide insights into team productivity.\\n\\n**Functionality:**\\n\\n* **Mood Analysis:** Analyzes commit messages for keywords (e.g., 'fix', 'feat', 'refactor') and code changes (lines and files changed) to assign a mood emoji (😴, 😤, 🤔, 😊, 🚀, 🔥).\\n* **Mood History:** Maintains a history of moods with timestamps and commit contexts for trend analysis.\\n* **Mood Trend:** Calculates the dominant mood over the last 5 commits.\\n* **Mood Report:** Generates a summary report for team standups, including current mood trend, total commits, recent activity, and a productivity tip.\\n\\n**How it works:**\\n\\nThe `analyzeMood` function assesses sentiment from the commit message and the number of lines/files changed.  This score is then used to assign a mood emoji and stored in the mood history. The `getMoodTrend` function analyzes the recent mood history to identify the current mood. The `generateMoodReport` function provides a neatly formatted summary of this data.\\n\\n**Example Usage:**\\n\\njavascript\\nconst tracker = new DeveloperMoodTracker();\\nconst mood = tracker.analyzeMood('Fix: Resolved critical bug', 150, 3);\\nconsole.log(mood); // Might output 😤\\nconsole.log(tracker.generateMoodReport());\\n\\n\\nThis feature is experimental and can be further improved with more sophisticated sentiment analysis and potentially integration with other metrics.\",\n+        \"created_at\": \"2025-07-20T13:19:20Z\",\n+        \"updated_at\": -0,0 +1,141 @@\n+/**\n+ * Developer Mood Tracker - Experimental Feature\n+ * Tracks developer mood based on commit patterns and code quality\n+ */\n+\n+class DeveloperMoodTracker {\n+  constructor() {\n+    this.moods = ['😴', '😤', '🤔', '😊', '🚀', '🔥'];\n+    this.moodHistory = [];\n+  }\n+\n+  /**\n+   * Analyze developer mood based on commit message and code changes\n+   * @param {string} commitMessage - The commit message\n+   * @param {number} linesChanged - Number of lines changed\n+   * @param {number} filesChanged - Number of files changed\n+   * @returns {string} Mood emoji\n+   */\n+  analyzeMood(commitMessage, linesChanged = 0, filesChanged = 0) {\n+    let moodScore = 3; // Default neutral mood\n+\n+    // Analyze commit message sentiment\n+    if (commitMessage.includes('fix') || commitMessage.includes('bug')) {\n+      moodScore -= 1; // Frustrated\n+    }\n+    if (commitMessage.includes('feat') || commitMessage.includes('add')) {\n+      moodScore += 1; // Happy\n+    }\n+    if (commitMessage.includes('refactor') || commitMessage.includes('clean')) {\n+      moodScore += 2; // Very productive\n+    }\n+    if (commitMessage.includes('WIP') || commitMessage.includes('temp')) {\n+      moodScore -= 2; // Tired/rushed\n+    }\n+\n+    // Factor in code changes\n+    if (linesChanged > 500) moodScore += 1; // Productive day\n+    if (filesChanged > 10) moodScore += 1; // Big feature work\n+\n+    // Clamp mood score\n+    moodScore = Math.max(0, Math.min(5, moodScore));\n+    \n+    const mood = this.moods[moodScore];\n+    this.recordMood(mood, commitMessage);\n+    \n+    return mood;\n+  }\n+\n+  /**\n+   * Record mood in history\n+   * @param {string} mood - Mood emoji\n+   * @param {string} context - Context (commit message)\n+   */\n+  recordMood(mood, context) {\n+    this.moodHistory.push({\n+      mood,\n+      context,\n+      timestamp: new Date().toISOString()\n+    });\n+\n+    // Keep only last 10 entries\n+    if (this.moodHistory.length > 10) {\n+      this.moodHistory.shift();\n+    }\n+  }\n+\n+  /**\n+   * Get current developer mood trend\n+   * @returns {object} Mood analysis\n+   */\n+  getMoodTrend() {\n+    if (this.moodHistory.length === 0) {\n+      return { trend: 'neutral', message: 'No mood data yet!' };\n+    }\n+\n+    const recentMoods = this.moodHistory.slice(-5);\n+    const moodCounts = {};\n+    \n+    recentMoods.forEach(entry => {\n+      moodCounts[entry.mood] = (moodCounts[entry.mood] || 0) + 1;\n+    });\n+\n+    const dominantMood = Object.keys(moodCounts).reduce((a, b) => \n+      moodCounts[a] > moodCounts[b] ? a : b\n+    );\n+\n+    const messages = {\n+      '😴': 'Time for coffee! You seem tired.',\n+      '😤': 'Lots of bug fixes lately. Hang in there!',\n+      '🤔': 'Deep thinking mode activated.',\n+      '😊': 'Good vibes! Keep up the great work.',\n+      '🚀': 'You\\'re on fire! Productivity through the roof!',\n+      '🔥': 'Absolute legend status achieved!'\n+    };\n+\n+    return {\n+      trend: dominantMood,\n+      message: messages[dominantMood] || 'Keep coding!',\n+      history: this.moodHistory\n+    };\n+  }\n+\n+  /**\n+   * Generate mood report for team standup\n+   * @returns {string} Formatted mood report\n+   */\n+  generateMoodReport() {\n+    const trend = this.getMoodTrend();\n+    const totalCommits = this.moodHistory.length;\n+    \n+    return `\n+🎯 Developer Mood Report\n+========================\n+Current Trend: ${trend.trend} ${trend.message}\n+Total Tracked Commits: ${totalCommits}\n+Recent Activity: ${this.moodHistory.slice(-3).map(h => h.mood).join(' ')}\n+\n+💡 Tip: ${this.getProductivityTip(trend.trend)}\n+    `.trim();\n+  }\n+\n+  /**\n+   * Get productivity tip based on mood\n+   * @param {string} mood - Current mood emoji\n+   * @returns {string} Productivity tip\n+   */\n+  getProductivityTip(mood) {\n+    const tips = {\n+      '😴': 'Take a break! Start tracking to see insights!';\n+    }\n+\n+    const weeklyData = this.teamMetrics.slice(-7);\n+    const avgScore = weeklyData.reduce((sum, day) => {\n+      return sum + this.productivityLevels.indexOf(day.level);\n+    }, 0) / weeklyData.length;\n+\n+    const currentLevel = this.productivityLevels[Math.round(avgScore)];\n+    const trend = this.calculateTrend(weeklyData);\n+\n+    return `\n+📊 Weekly Team Productivity Report\n+==================================\n+Current Level: ${currentLevel} (${this.getLevelName(currentLevel)})\n+Weekly Trend: ${trend.direction} ${trend.emoji}\n+Days Tracked: ${weeklyData.length}\n+\n+📈 Key Insights:\n+${weeklyData.slice(-3).map(day => `• ${day.date}: ${day.level} - ${day.analysis}`).join('\\n')}\n+\n+🎯 Focus Areas:\n+${this.getRecommendations(Math.round(avgScore)).slice(0, 3).map(rec => `• ${rec}`).join('\\n')}\n+\n+💡 Team Health Score: ${Math.round(avgScore * 20)}%\n+    `.trim();\n+  }\n+\n+  /**\n+   * Calculate productivity trend\n+   * @param {array} data - Recent metrics data\n+   * @returns {object} Trend information\n+   */\n+  calculateTrend(data) {\n+    if (data.length < 2) return { direction: 'Stable', emoji: '➡️' };\n+\n+    const recent = data.slice(-3).map(d => this.productivityLevels.indexOf(d.level));\n+    const older = data.slice(-6, -3).map(d => this.productivityLevels.indexOf(d.level));\n+\n+    const recentAvg = recent.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0) / recent.length;\n+    const olderAvg = older.length > 0 ? // Default neutral mood\\n+\\n+    // Analyze commit message sentiment\\n+    if (commitMessage.includes('fix') || commitMessage.includes('bug')) {\\n+      moodScore -= 1; // Frustrated\\n+    }\\n+    if (commitMessage.includes('feat') || commitMessage.includes('add')) {\\n+      moodScore += 1; // Happy\\n+    }\\n+    if (commitMessage.includes('refactor') || commitMessage.includes('clean')) {\\n+      moodScore += 2; // Very productive\\n+    }\\n+    if (commitMessage.includes('WIP') || commitMessage.includes('temp')) {\\n+      moodScore -= 2; // Tired/rushed\\n+    }\\n+\\n+    // Factor in code changes\\n+    if (linesChanged > 500) moodScore += 1; // Productive day\\n+    if (filesChanged > 10) moodScore += 1; // Big feature work\\n+\\n+    // Clamp mood score\\n+    moodScore = Math.max(0, Math.min(5, moodScore));\\n+    \\n+    const mood = this.moods[moodScore];\\n+    this.recordMood(mood, commitMessage);\\n+    \\n+    return mood;\\n+  }\\n+\\n+  /**\\n+   * Record mood in history\\n+   * @param {string} mood - Mood emoji\\n+   * @param {string} context - Context (commit message)\\n+   */\\n+  recordMood(mood, context) {\\n+    this.moodHistory.push({\\n+      mood,\\n+      context,\\n+      timestamp: new Date().toISOString()\\n+    });\\n+\\n+    // Keep only last 10 entries\\n+    if (this.moodHistory.length > 10) {\\n+      this.moodHistory.shift();\\n+    }\\n+  }\\n+\\n+  /**\\n+   * Get current developer mood trend\\n+   * @returns {object} Mood analysis\\n+   */\\n+  getMoodTrend() {\\n+    if (this.moodHistory.length === 0) {\\n+      return { trend: 'neutral', message: 'No mood data yet!' };\\n+    }\\n+\\n+    const recentMoods = this.moodHistory.slice(-5);\\n+    const moodCounts = {};\\n+    \\n+    recentMoods.forEach(entry => {\\n+      moodCounts[entry.mood] = (moodCounts[entry.mood] || 0) + 1;\\n+    });\\n+\\n+    const dominantMood = Object.keys(moodCounts).reduce((a, b) => \\n+      moodCounts[a] > moodCounts[b] ? a : b\\n+    );\\n+\\n+    const messages = {\\n+      '😴': 'Time for coffee! You seem tired.',\\n+      '😤': 'Lots of bug fixes lately. Hang in there!',\\n+      '🤔': 'Deep thinking mode activated.',\\n+      '😊': 'Good vibes! Keep up the great work.',\\n+      '🚀': 'You\\\\'re on fire! Productivity through the roof!',\\n+      '🔥': 'Absolute legend status achieved!'\\n+    };\\n+\\n+    return {\\n+      trend: dominantMood,\\n+      message: messages[dominantMood] || 'Keep coding!',\\n+      history: this.moodHistory\\n+    };\\n+  }\\n+\\n+  /**\\n+   * Generate mood report for team standup\\n+   * @returns {string} Formatted mood report\\n+   */\\n+  generateMoodReport() {\\n+    const trend = this.getMoodTrend();\\n+    const totalCommits = this.moodHistory.length;\\n+    \\n+    return `\\n+🎯 Developer Mood Report\\n+========================\\n+Current Trend: ${trend.trend} ${trend.message}\\n+Total Tracked Commits: ${totalCommits}\\n+Recent Activity: ${this.moodHistory.slice(-3).map(h => h.mood).join(' ')}\\n+\\n+💡 Tip: ${this.getProductivityTip(trend.trend)}\\n+    `.trim();\\n+  }\\n+\\n+  /**\\n+   * Get productivity tip based on mood\\n+   * @param {string} mood - Current mood emoji\\n+   * @returns {string} Productivity tip\\n+   */\\n+  getProductivityTip(mood) {\\n+    const tips = {\\n+      '😴': 'Take a break! Fresh air and coffee work wonders.',\\n+      '😤': 'Consider pair programming for tough bugs.',\\n+      '🤔': 'Document your thought process - future you will thank you!',\\n+      '😊': 'Great momentum! Maybe tackle that refactoring task?',\\n+      '🚀': 'Perfect time to mentor a junior developer!',\\n+      '🔥': 'Share your success with the team - inspire others!'\\n+    };\\n+    \\n+    return `DeveloperMoodTracker`. This class analyzes commit messages and code changes to gauge developer mood and provide insights into team productivity.\\n\\n**Functionality:**\\n\\n* **Mood Analysis:** Analyzes commit messages for keywords (e.g., 'fix', 'feat', 'refactor') and code changes (lines and files changed) to assign a mood emoji (😴, 😤, 🤔, 😊, 🚀, 🔥).\\n* **Mood History:** Maintains a history of moods with timestamps and commit contexts for trend analysis.\\n* **Mood Trend:** Calculates the dominant mood over the last 5 commits.\\n* **Mood Report:** Generates a summary report for team standups, including current mood trend, total commits, recent activity, and a productivity tip.\\n\\n**How it works:**\\n\\nThe `analyzeMood` function assesses sentiment from the commit message and the number of lines/files changed.  This score is then used to assign a mood emoji and stored in the mood history. The `getMoodTrend` function analyzes the recent mood history to identify the current mood. The `generateMoodReport` function provides a neatly formatted summary of this data.\\n\\n**Example Usage:**\\n\\njavascript\\nconst tracker = new DeveloperMoodTracker();\\nconst mood = tracker.analyzeMood('Fix: Resolved critical bug', 150, 3);\\nconsole.log(mood); // Might output 😤\\nconsole.log(tracker.generateMoodReport());\\n\\n\\nThis feature is experimental and can be further improved with more sophisticated sentiment analysis and potentially integration with other metrics.\",\n+      \"summary\": \"Adds an experimental feature to track developer mood based on commit \"body\": \"This PR introduces an experimental feature called `DeveloperMoodTracker`. This class analyzes commit messages and code changes to gauge developer mood and provide insights into team productivity.\\n\\n**Functionality:**\\n\\n* **Mood Analysis:** Analyzes commit messages for keywords (e.g., 'fix', 'feat', 'refactor') and code changes (lines and files changed) to assign a mood emoji (😴, 😤, 🤔, 😊, 🚀, 🔥).\\n* **Mood History:** Maintains a history of moods with timestamps and commit contexts for trend analysis.\\n* **Mood Trend:** Calculates the dominant mood over the last 5 commits.\\n* **Mood Report:** Generates a summary report for team standups, including current mood trend, total commits, recent activity, and a productivity tip.\\n\\n**How it works:**\\n\\nThe `analyzeMood` function assesses sentiment from the commit message and the number of lines/files changed.  This score is then used to assign a mood emoji and stored in the mood history. The `getMoodTrend` function analyzes the recent mood history to identify the current mood. The `generateMoodReport` function provides a neatly formatted summary of this data.\\n\\n**Example Usage:**\\n\\njavascript\\nconst tracker = new DeveloperMoodTracker();\\nconst mood = tracker.analyzeMood('Fix: Resolved critical bug', 150, 3);\\nconsole.log(mood); // Might output 😤\\nconsole.log(tracker.generateMoodReport());\\n\\n\\nThis feature is experimental and can be further improved with more sophisticated sentiment analysis and potentially integration with other metrics.\",\n+        \"created_at\": \"2025-07-20T13:19:20Z\",\n+        \"updated_at\": This class analyzes commit messages and code changes to gauge developer mood and provide insights into team productivity.\\\\n\\\\n**Functionality:**\\\\n\\\\n* **Mood Analysis:** Analyzes commit messages for keywords (e.g., 'fix', 'feat', 'refactor') and code changes (lines and files changed) to assign a mood emoji (😴, 😤, 🤔, 😊, 🚀, 🔥).\\\\n* **Mood History:** Maintains a history of moods with timestamps and commit contexts for trend analysis.\\\\n* **Mood Trend:** Calculates the dominant mood over the last 5 commits.\\\\n* **Mood Report:** Generates a summary report for team standups, including current mood trend, total commits, recent activity, and a productivity tip.\\\\n\\\\n**How it works:**\\\\n\\\\nThe `analyzeMood` function assesses sentiment from the commit message and the number of lines/files changed.  This score is then used to assign a mood emoji and stored in the mood history. The `getMoodTrend` function analyzes the recent mood history to identify the current mood. The `generateMoodReport` function provides a neatly formatted summary of this data.\\\\n\\\\n**Example Usage:**\\\\n\\\\njavascript\\\\nconst tracker = new DeveloperMoodTracker();\\\\nconst mood = tracker.analyzeMood('Fix: Resolved critical bug', 150, 3);\\\\nconsole.log(mood); // Might output 😤\\\\nconsole.log(tracker.generateMoodReport());\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nThis feature is experimental and can be   \\\"site_admin\\\": false\\n+        },\\n+        \\\"body\\\": \\\"This PR introduces an experimental feature called `DeveloperMoodTracker`. This class analyzes commit messages and code changes to gauge developer mood and provide insights into team productivity.\\\\n\\\\n**Functionality:**\\\\n\\\\n* **Mood Analysis:** Analyzes commit messages for keywords (e.g., 'fix', 'feat', 'refactor') and code changes (lines and files changed) to assign a mood emoji (😴, 😤, 🤔, 😊, 🚀, 🔥).\\\\n* **Mood History:** Maintains a history of moods with timestamps and commit contexts for trend analysis.\\\\n* **Mood Trend:** Calculates the dominant mood over the last 5 commits.\\\\n* **Mood Report:** Generates a summary report for team standups, including current mood trend, total commits, recent activity, and a productivity tip.\\\\n\\\\n**How it works:**\\\\n\\\\nThe `analyzeMood` function assesses sentiment from the commit message and the number of lines/files changed.  This score is then used to assign a mood emoji and stored in the mood history. The `getMoodTrend` function analyzes the recent mood history to identify the current mood. The `generateMoodReport` function provides a neatly formatted summary of this data.\\\\n\\\\n**Example Usage:**\\\\n\\\\njavascript\\\\nconst tracker = new DeveloperMoodTracker();\\\\nconst mood = tracker.analyzeMood('Fix: Resolved critical bug', 150, 3);\\\\nconsole.log(mood); // Might output 😤\\\\nconsole.log(tracker.generateMoodReport());\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nThis feature is experimental and can be further improved with more sophisticated sentiment analysis and potentially integration with other metrics.\\\",\\n+        \\\"created_at\\\": \\\"2025-07-20T13:19:20Z\\\",\\n+ }\n+\n+  /**\n+   * Analyze team productivity based on various metrics\n+   * @param {object} metrics - Team metrics data\n+   * @returns {object} Productivity analysis\n+   */\n+ generateProductivityInsight(score, metrics) {\n+    const insights = {\n+      0: `Team seems to be in planning mode. Team is in the zone with high-quality output.`,\n+      5: `Outstanding performance! Team is operating at peak efficiency.`\n+    };\n+\n+    let insight = insights[score];\n+    \n+    // Add specific observations\n+    if (metrics.bugsFixed > metrics.featuresDelivered) {\n+      insight += ` Focus on bug fixes suggests stabilization phase.`;\n+    }\n+    if (metrics.codeReviewTime > 6) {\n+      insight += ` Code review bottleneck detected.`;\n+    }\n+    if (metrics.commitsPerDay > 15) {\n+      insight += ` High commit frequency - Start tracking to see insights!';\n+    }\n+\n+    const weeklyData = this.teamMetrics.slice(-7);\n+    const avgScore = weeklyData.reduce((sum, day) => {\n+      return sum + this.productivityLevels.indexOf(day.level);\n+    }, 0) / weeklyData.length;\n+\n+    const currentLevel = this.productivityLevels[Math.round(avgScore)];\n+    const trend = this.calculateTrend(weeklyData);\n+\n+    return `\n+📊 Weekly Team Productivity Report\n+==================================\n+Current Level: ${currentLevel} (${this.getLevelName(currentLevel)})\n+Weekly Trend: ${trend.direction} ${trend.emoji}\n+Days Tracked: ${weeklyData.length}\n+\n+📈 Key Insights:\n+${weeklyData.slice(-3).map(day => `• ${day.date}: ${day.level} - ${day.analysis}`).join('\\n')}\n+\n+🎯 Focus Areas:\n+${this.getRecommendations(Math.round(avgScore)).slice(0, 3).map(rec => `• ${rec}`).join('\\n')}\n+\n+💡 Team Health Score: ${Math.round(avgScore * 20)}%\n+    `.trim();\n+  }\n+\n+  /**\n+   * Calculate productivity trend\n+   * @param {array} data - Recent metrics data\n+   * @returns {object} Trend information\n+   */\n+  calculateTrend(data) {\n+    if (data.length < 2) return { direction: 'Stable', emoji: '➡️' };\n+\n+    const recent = data.slice(-3).map(d => this.productivityLevels.indexOf(d.level));\n+    const older = data.slice(-6, -3).map(d => this.productivityLevels.indexOf(d.level));\n+\n+    const recentAvg = recent.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0) / recent.length;\n+    const olderAvg = older.length > 0 ? older.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0) / older.length : recentAvg;\n+\n+    if (recentAvg > olderAvg + 0.5) return { direction: 'Improving', emoji: '📈' };\n+    if (recentAvg < olderAvg - 0.5) return { direction: 'Declining', emoji: '📉' };\n+    return { direction: 'Stable', emoji: '➡️' };\n+  }\n+\n+  /**\n+   * Get human-readable level name\n+   * @param {string} emoji - Level emoji\n+   * @returns {string} Level name\n+   */\n+  getLevelName(emoji) {\n+    const names = {\n+      '🐌': 'Planning Phase',\n+      '🚶': 'Steady Progress',\n+      '🏃': 'Good Momentum',\n+      '🚀': 'High Performance',\n+      '⚡': 'Peak Efficiency',\n+      '🔥': 'Exceptional Output'\n+    };\n+    return names[emoji] || 'Unknown';\n+  }\n+\n+  /**\n+   * Get team productivity insights for stakeholders\n+   * @returns {object} Executive summary\n+   */\n+  getExecutiveSummary() {\n+    const recentMetrics = this.teamMetrics.slice(-7);\n+    if (recentMetrics.length === 0) {\n+      return { status: 'No data available' };\n+    }\n+\n+    const avgProductivity = recentMetrics.reduce((sum, day) => {\n+      return sum + this.productivityLevels.indexOf(day.level);\n+    }, 0) / recentMetrics.length;\n+\n+    const healthScore = Math.round(avgProductivity * 20);\n+    const status = healthScore > 80 ? // Base level\n+\n+    // Analyze commit frequency\n+    if (commitsPerDay > 10) productivityScore += 2;\n+    else if (commitsPerDay > 5) productivityScore += 1;\n+    else if (commitsPerDay < 2) productivityScore -= 1;\n+\n+    // Factor in code quality indicators\n+    if (pullRequestsMerged > 3) productivityScore += 1;\n+    if (bugsFixed > 5) productivityScore += 1;\n+    if (featuresDelivered > 2) productivityScore += 2;\n+\n+    // Code review efficiency\n+    if (codeReviewTime < 2) productivityScore += 1; Team is maintaining consistent output.`,\n+      3: `Strong performance! Team is delivering quality work efficiently.`,\n+      4: `Excellent productivity! Team is in the zone with high-quality output.`,\n+      5: `Outstanding performance! Team is operating at peak efficiency.`\n+    };\n+\n+    let insight = insights[score];\n+    \n+    // Add specific observations\n+    if (metrics.bugsFixed > metrics.featuresDelivered) {\n+      insight += ` Focus on bug fixes suggests stabilization phase.`;\n+    }\n+    if (metrics.codeReviewTime > 6) {\n+      insight += ` Code review bottleneck detected.`;\n+    }\n+    if (metrics.commitsPerDay > 15) {\n+      insight += ` High commit frequency - Start tracking to see insights!';\n+    }\n+\n+    const weeklyData = this.teamMetrics.slice(-7);\n+    const avgScore = weeklyData.reduce((sum, day) => {\n+      return sum + this.productivityLevels.indexOf(day.level);\n+    }, 0) / weeklyData.length;\n+\n+    const currentLevel = this.productivityLevels[Math.round(avgScore)];\n+    const trend = this.calculateTrend(weeklyData);\n+\n+    return `\n+📊 Weekly Team Productivity Report\n+==================================\n+Current Level: ${currentLevel} (${this.getLevelName(currentLevel)})\n+Weekly Trend: ${trend.direction} ${trend.emoji}\n+Days Tracked: ${weeklyData.length}\n+\n+📈 Key Insights:\n+${weeklyData.slice(-3).map(day => `• ${day.date}: ${day.level} - ${day.analysis}`).join('\\n')}\n+\n+🎯 Focus Areas:\n+${this.getRecommendations(Math.round(avgScore)).slice(0, 3).map(rec => `• ${rec}`).join('\\n')}\n+\n+💡 Team Health Score: ${Math.round(avgScore * 20)}%\n+    `.trim();\n+  }\n+\n+  /**\n+   * Calculate productivity trend\n+   * @param {array} data - Recent metrics data\n+   * @returns {object} Trend information\n+   */\n+  calculateTrend(data) {\n+    if (data.length < 2) return { direction: 'Stable', emoji: '➡️' };\n+\n+    const recent = data.slice(-3).map(d => this.productivityLevels.indexOf(d.level));\n+    const older = data.slice(-6, -3).map(d => this.productivityLevels.indexOf(d.level));\n+\n+    const recentAvg = recent.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0) / recent.length;\n+    const olderAvg = older.length > 0 ? older.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0) / older.length : recentAvg;\n+\n+    if (recentAvg > olderAvg + 0.5) return { direction: 'Improving', emoji: '📈' };\n+    if (recentAvg < olderAvg - 0.5) return { direction: 'Declining', emoji: '📉' };\n+    return { direction: 'Stable', emoji: '➡️' };\n+  }\n+\n+  /**\n+   * Get human-readable level name\n+   * @param {string} emoji - Level emoji\n+   * @returns {string} Level name\n+   */\n+  getLevelName(emoji) {\n+    const names = {\n+      '🐌': 'Planning Phase',\n+      '🚶': 'Steady Progress',\n+      '🏃': 'Good Momentum',\n+      '🚀': 'High Performance',\n+      '⚡': 'Peak Efficiency',\n+      '🔥': 'Exceptional Output'\n+    };\n+    return names[emoji] || 'Unknown';\n+  }\n+\n+  /**\n+   * Get team productivity insights for stakeholders\n+   * @returns {object} Executive summary\n+   */\n+  getExecutiveSummary() {\n+    const recentMetrics = this.teamMetrics.slice(-7);\n+    if (recentMetrics.length === 0) {\n+      return { status: 'No data available' };\n+    }\n+\n+    const avgProductivity = recentMetrics.reduce((sum, day) => {\n+      return sum + this.productivityLevels.indexOf(day.level);\n+    }, 0) / recentMetrics.length;\n+\n+    const healthScore = Math.round(avgProductivity * 20);\n+    const status = healthScore > 80 ? 'Fair' : 'Needs Attention';\n+\n+    return {\n+      status,\n+      healthScore,\n+      currentLevel: this.productivityLevels[Math.round(avgProductivity)],\n+      keyMetrics: {\n+        averageCommitsPerDay: Math.round(recentMetrics.reduce((sum, d) => sum + (d.metrics.commitsPerDay || 0), 0) / recentMetrics.length),\n+        averagePRsMerged: Math.round(recentMetrics.reduce((sum, d) => sum + (d.metrics.pullRequestsMerged || 0), 0) / recentMetrics.length),\n+        averageReviewTime: Math.round(recentMetrics.reduce((sum, d) => sum + (d.metrics.codeReviewTime || 0), 0) / recentMetrics.length)\n+      },\n+      recommendations: this.getRecommendations(Math.round(avgProductivity)).slice(0, 2)\n+    };\n+  }\n+}\n+\n+module.exports = TeamProductivityAnalyzer;\n\\ No newline at end of file",

diff --git a/TeamProductivityAnalyzer new.js b/TeamProductivityAnalyzer new.js
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..5c62e0c
--- /dev/null
+++ b/TeamProductivityAnalyzer new.js	
@@ -0,0 +1,256 @@
+/**
+ * Team Productivity Analyzer - Experimental Feature
+ * Analyzes team productivity patterns and provides insights
+ */
+
+class TeamProductivityAnalyzer {
+  constructor() {
+    this.productivityLevels = ['🐌', '🚶', '🏃', '🚀', '⚡', '🔥'];
+    this.teamMetrics = [];
+    this.insights = [];
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Analyze team productivity based on various metrics
+   * @param {object} metrics - Team metrics data
+   * @returns {object} Productivity analysis
+   */
+  analyzeTeamProductivity(metrics) {
+    const {
+      commitsPerDay = 0,
+      linesOfCode = 0,
+      pullRequestsMerged = 0,
+      bugsFixed = 0,
+      featuresDelivered = 0,
+      codeReviewTime = 0
+    } = metrics;
+
+    let productivityScore = 2; // Base level
+
+    // Analyze commit frequency
+    if (commitsPerDay > 10) productivityScore += 2;
+    else if (commitsPerDay > 5) productivityScore += 1;
+    else if (commitsPerDay < 2) productivityScore -= 1;
+
+    // Factor in code quality indicators
+    if (pullRequestsMerged > 3) productivityScore += 1;
+    if (bugsFixed > 5) productivityScore += 1;
+    if (featuresDelivered > 2) productivityScore += 2;
+
+    // Code review efficiency
+    if (codeReviewTime < 2) productivityScore += 1; // Fast reviews
+    else if (codeReviewTime > 8) productivityScore -= 1; // Slow reviews
+
+    // Clamp score
+    productivityScore = Math.max(0, Math.min(5, productivityScore));
+    
+    const level = this.productivityLevels[productivityScore];
+    const analysis = this.generateProductivityInsight(productivityScore, metrics);
+    
+    this.recordMetrics(level, metrics, analysis);
+    
+    return {
+      level,
+      score: productivityScore,
+      analysis,
+      recommendations: this.getRecommendations(productivityScore)
+    };
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Generate productivity insight based on metrics
+   * @param {number} score - Productivity score
+   * @param {object} metrics - Raw metrics
+   * @returns {string} Insight message
+   */
+  generateProductivityInsight(score, metrics) {
+    const insights = {
+      0: `Team seems to be in planning mode. Low activity detected.`,
+      1: `Steady progress but room for improvement. Consider sprint planning review.`,
+      2: `Good baseline productivity. Team is maintaining consistent output.`,
+      3: `Strong performance! Team is delivering quality work efficiently.`,
+      4: `Excellent productivity! Team is in the zone with high-quality output.`,
+      5: `Outstanding performance! Team is operating at peak efficiency.`
+    };
+
+    let insight = insights[score];
+    
+    // Add specific observations
+    if (metrics.bugsFixed > metrics.featuresDelivered) {
+      insight += ` Focus on bug fixes suggests stabilization phase.`;
+    }
+    if (metrics.codeReviewTime > 6) {
+      insight += ` Code review bottleneck detected.`;
+    }
+    if (metrics.commitsPerDay > 15) {
+      insight += ` High commit frequency - ensure code quality isn't compromised.`;
+    }
+
+    return insight;
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Record team metrics in history
+   * @param {string} level - Productivity level emoji
+   * @param {object} metrics - Metrics data
+   * @param {string} analysis - Analysis text
+   */
+  recordMetrics(level, metrics, analysis) {
+    this.teamMetrics.push({
+      level,
+      metrics,
+      analysis,
+      timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
+      date: new Date().toDateString()
+    });
+
+    // Keep last 30 days
+    if (this.teamMetrics.length > 30) {
+      this.teamMetrics.shift();
+    }
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Get productivity recommendations
+   * @param {number} score - Current productivity score
+   * @returns {array} Array of recommendations
+   */
+  getRecommendations(score) {
+    const recommendations = {
+      0: [
+        'Schedule team sync to identify blockers',
+        'Review sprint goals and priorities',
+        'Consider pair programming sessions'
+      ],
+      1: [
+        'Implement daily standups if not already',
+        'Review and optimize development workflow',
+        'Identify and remove process bottlenecks'
+      ],
+      2: [
+        'Maintain current momentum',
+        'Consider code quality metrics tracking',
+        'Plan for upcoming sprint capacity'
+      ],
+      3: [
+        'Document successful practices for replication',
+        'Consider mentoring other teams',
+        'Explore automation opportunities'
+      ],
+      4: [
+        'Share best practices with organization',
+        'Consider taking on stretch goals',
+        'Invest in team skill development'
+      ],
+      5: [
+        'Maintain sustainable pace to avoid burnout',
+        'Lead innovation initiatives',
+        'Become productivity champions for other teams'
+      ]
+    };
+
+    return recommendations[score] || ['Keep up the great work!'];
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Generate weekly team report
+   * @returns {string} Formatted team report
+   */
+  generateWeeklyReport() {
+    if (this.teamMetrics.length === 0) {
+      return 'No team metrics available yet. Start tracking to see insights!';
+    }
+
+    const weeklyData = this.teamMetrics.slice(-7);
+    const avgScore = weeklyData.reduce((sum, day) => {
+      return sum + this.productivityLevels.indexOf(day.level);
+    }, 0) / weeklyData.length;
+
+    const currentLevel = this.productivityLevels[Math.round(avgScore)];
+    const trend = this.calculateTrend(weeklyData);
+
+    return `
+📊 Weekly Team Productivity Report
+==================================
+Current Level: ${currentLevel} (${this.getLevelName(currentLevel)})
+Weekly Trend: ${trend.direction} ${trend.emoji}
+Days Tracked: ${weeklyData.length}
+
+📈 Key Insights:
+${weeklyData.slice(-3).map(day => `• ${day.date}: ${day.level} - ${day.analysis}`).join('\n')}
+
+🎯 Focus Areas:
+${this.getRecommendations(Math.round(avgScore)).slice(0, 3).map(rec => `• ${rec}`).join('\n')}
+
+💡 Team Health Score: ${Math.round(avgScore * 20)}%
+    `.trim();
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Calculate productivity trend
+   * @param {array} data - Recent metrics data
+   * @returns {object} Trend information
+   */
+  calculateTrend(data) {
+    if (data.length < 2) return { direction: 'Stable', emoji: '➡️' };
+
+    const recent = data.slice(-3).map(d => this.productivityLevels.indexOf(d.level));
+    const older = data.slice(-6, -3).map(d => this.productivityLevels.indexOf(d.level));
+
+    const recentAvg = recent.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0) / recent.length;
+    const olderAvg = older.length > 0 ? older.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0) / older.length : recentAvg;
+
+    if (recentAvg > olderAvg + 0.5) return { direction: 'Improving', emoji: '📈' };
+    if (recentAvg < olderAvg - 0.5) return { direction: 'Declining', emoji: '📉' };
+    return { direction: 'Stable', emoji: '➡️' };
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Get human-readable level name
+   * @param {string} emoji - Level emoji
+   * @returns {string} Level name
+   */
+  getLevelName(emoji) {
+    const names = {
+      '🐌': 'Planning Phase',
+      '🚶': 'Steady Progress',
+      '🏃': 'Good Momentum',
+      '🚀': 'High Performance',
+      '⚡': 'Peak Efficiency',
+      '🔥': 'Exceptional Output'
+    };
+    return names[emoji] || 'Unknown';
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Get team productivity insights for stakeholders
+   * @returns {object} Executive summary
+   */
+  getExecutiveSummary() {
+    const recentMetrics = this.teamMetrics.slice(-7);
+    if (recentMetrics.length === 0) {
+      return { status: 'No data available' };
+    }
+
+    const avgProductivity = recentMetrics.reduce((sum, day) => {
+      return sum + this.productivityLevels.indexOf(day.level);
+    }, 0) / recentMetrics.length;
+
+    const healthScore = Math.round(avgProductivity * 20);
+    const status = healthScore > 80 ? 'Excellent' : healthScore > 60 ? 'Good' : healthScore > 40 ? 'Fair' : 'Needs Attention';
+
+    return {
+      status,
+      healthScore,
+      currentLevel: this.productivityLevels[Math.round(avgProductivity)],
+      keyMetrics: {
+        averageCommitsPerDay: Math.round(recentMetrics.reduce((sum, d) => sum + (d.metrics.commitsPerDay || 0), 0) / recentMetrics.length),
+        averagePRsMerged: Math.round(recentMetrics.reduce((sum, d) => sum + (d.metrics.pullRequestsMerged || 0), 0) / recentMetrics.length),
+        averageReviewTime: Math.round(recentMetrics.reduce((sum, d) => sum + (d.metrics.codeReviewTime || 0), 0) / recentMetrics.length)
+      },
+      recommendations: this.getRecommendations(Math.round(avgProductivity)).slice(0, 2)
+    };
+  }
+}
+
+module.exports = TeamProductivityAnalyzer;

+${weeklyData.slice(-3).map(day => `• ${day.date}: ${day.level} - ${day.analysis}`).join('\n')}
+
+🎯 Focus Areas:
+${this.getRecommendations(Math.round(avgScore)).slice(0, 3).map(rec => `• ${rec}`).join('\n')}
+
+💡 Team Health Score: ${Math.round(avgScore * 20)}%
+    `.trim();
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Calculate productivity trend
+   * @param {array} data - Recent metrics data
+   * @returns {object} Trend information
+   */
+  calculateTrend(data) {
+    if (data.length < 2) return { direction: 'Stable', emoji: '➡️' };
+
+    const recent = data.slice(-3).map(d => this.productivityLevels.indexOf(d.level));
+    const older = data.slice(-6, -3).map(d => this.productivityLevels.indexOf(d.level));
+
+    const recentAvg = recent.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0) / recent.length;
+    const olderAvg = older.length > 0 ? older.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0) / older.length : recentAvg;
+
+    if (recentAvg > olderAvg + 0.5) return { direction: 'Improving', emoji: '📈' };
+    if (recentAvg < olderAvg - 0.5) return { direction: 'Declining', emoji: '📉' };
+    return { direction: 'Stable', emoji: '➡️' };
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Get human-readable level name
+   * @param {string} emoji - Level emoji
+   * @returns {string} Level name
+   */
+  getLevelName(emoji) {
+    const names = {
+      '🐌': 'Planning Phase',
+      '🚶': 'Steady Progress',
+      '🏃': 'Good Momentum',
+      '🚀': 'High Performance',
+      '⚡': 'Peak Efficiency',
+      '🔥': 'Exceptional Output'
+    };
+    return names[emoji] || 'Unknown';
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Get team productivity insights for stakeholders
+   * @returns {object} Executive summary
+   */
+  getExecutiveSummary() {
+    const recentMetrics = this.teamMetrics.slice(-7);
+    if (recentMetrics.length === 0) {
+      return { status: 'No data available' };
+    }
+
+    const avgProductivity = recentMetrics.reduce((sum, day) => {
+      return sum + this.productivityLevels.indexOf(day.level);
+    }, 0) / recentMetrics.length;
+
+    const healthScore = Math.round(avgProductivity * 20);
+    const status = healthScore > 80 ? 'Excellent' : healthScore > 60 ? 'Good' : healthScore > 40 ? 'Fair' : 'Needs Attention';
+
+    return {
+      status,
+      healthScore,
+      currentLevel: this.productivityLevels[Math.round(avgProductivity)],
+      keyMetrics: {
+        averageCommitsPerDay: Math.round(recentMetrics.reduce((sum, d) => sum + (d.metrics.commitsPerDay || 0), 0) / recentMetrics.length),
+        averagePRsMerged: Math.round(recentMetrics.reduce((sum, d) => sum + (d.metrics.pullRequestsMerged || 0), 0) / recentMetrics.length),
+        averageReviewTime: Math.round(recentMetrics.reduce((sum, d) => sum + (d.metrics.codeReviewTime || 0), 0) / recentMetrics.length)
+      },
+      recommendations: this.getRecommendations(Math.round(avgProductivity)).slice(0, 2)
+    };
+  }
+}
+
+module.exports = TeamProductivityAnalyzer;

@@ -0,0 +1,141 @@
+/**
+ * Developer Mood Tracker - Experimental Feature
+ * Tracks developer mood based on commit patterns and code quality
+ */
+
+class DeveloperMoodTracker {
+  constructor() {
+    this.moods = ['😴', '😤', '🤔', '😊', '🚀', '🔥'];
+    this.moodHistory = [];
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Analyze developer mood based on commit message and code changes
+   * @param {string} commitMessage - The commit message
+   * @param {number} linesChanged - Number of lines changed
+   * @param {number} filesChanged - Number of files changed
+   * @returns {string} Mood emoji
+   */
+  analyzeMood(commitMessage, linesChanged = 0, filesChanged = 0) {
+    let moodScore = 3; // Default neutral mood
+
+    // Analyze commit message sentiment
+    if (commitMessage.includes('fix') || commitMessage.includes('bug')) {
+      moodScore -= 1; // Frustrated
+    }
+    if (commitMessage.includes('feat') || commitMessage.includes('add')) {
+      moodScore += 1; // Happy
+    }
+    if (commitMessage.includes('refactor') || commitMessage.includes('clean')) {
+      moodScore += 2; // Very productive
+    }
+    if (commitMessage.includes('WIP') || commitMessage.includes('temp')) {
+      moodScore -= 2; // Tired/rushed
+    }
+
+    // Factor in code changes
+    if (linesChanged > 500) moodScore += 1; // Productive day
+    if (filesChanged > 10) moodScore += 1; // Big feature work
+
+    // Clamp mood score
+    moodScore = Math.max(0, Math.min(5, moodScore));
+    
+    const mood = this.moods[moodScore];
+    this.recordMood(mood, commitMessage);
+    
+    return mood;
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Record mood in history
+   * @param {string} mood - Mood emoji
+   * @param {string} context - Context (commit message)
+   */
+  recordMood(mood, context) {
+    this.moodHistory.push({
+      mood,
+      context,
+      timestamp: new Date().toISOString()
+    });
+
+    // Keep only last 10 entries
+    if (this.moodHistory.length > 10) {
+      this.moodHistory.shift();
+    }
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Get current developer mood trend
+   * @returns {object} Mood analysis
+   */
+  getMoodTrend() {
+    if (this.moodHistory.length === 0) {
+      return { trend: 'neutral', message: 'No mood data yet!' };
+    }
+
+    const recentMoods = this.moodHistory.slice(-5);
+    const moodCounts = {};
+    
+    recentMoods.forEach(entry => {
+      moodCounts[entry.mood] = (moodCounts[entry.mood] || 0) + 1;
+    });
+
+    const dominantMood = Object.keys(moodCounts).reduce((a, b) => 
+      moodCounts[a] > moodCounts[b] ? a : b
+    );
+
+    const messages = {
+      '😴': 'Time for coffee! You seem tired.',
+      '😤': 'Lots of bug fixes lately. Hang in there!',
+      '🤔': 'Deep thinking mode activated.',
+      '😊': 'Good vibes! Keep up the great work.',
+      '🚀': 'You\'re on fire! Productivity through the roof!',
+      '🔥': 'Absolute legend status achieved!'
+    };
+
+    return {
+      trend: dominantMood,
+      message: messages[dominantMood] || 'Keep coding!',
+      history: this.moodHistory
+    };
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Generate mood report for team standup
+   * @returns {string} Formatted mood report
+   */
+  generateMoodReport() {
+    const trend = this.getMoodTrend();
+    const totalCommits = this.moodHistory.length;
+    
+    return `
+🎯 Developer Mood Report
+========================
+Current Trend: ${trend.trend} ${trend.message}
+Total Tracked Commits: ${totalCommits}
+Recent Activity: ${this.moodHistory.slice(-3).map(h => h.mood).join(' ')}
+
+💡 Tip: ${this.getProductivityTip(trend.trend)}
+    `.trim();
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Get productivity tip based on mood
+   * @param {string} mood - Current mood emoji
+   * @returns {string} Productivity tip
+   */
+  getProductivityTip(mood) {
+    const tips = {
+      '😴': 'Take a break! Fresh air and coffee work wonders.',
+      '😤': 'Consider pair programming for tough bugs.',
+      '🤔': 'Document your thought process - future you will thank you!',
+      '😊': 'Great momentum! Maybe tackle that refactoring task?',
+      '🚀': 'Perfect time to mentor a junior developer!',
+      '🔥': 'Share your success with the team - inspire others!'
+    };
+    
+    return tips[mood] || 'Keep being awesome!';
+  }
+}
+
+module.exports = DeveloperMoodTracker;

+/**
+ * Team Productivity Analyzer - Experimental Feature
+ * Analyzes team productivity patterns and provides insights
+ */
+
+class TeamProductivityAnalyzer {
+  constructor() {
+    this.productivityLevels = ['🐌', '🚶', '🏃', '🚀', '⚡', '🔥'];
+    this.teamMetrics = [];
+    this.insights = [];
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Analyze team productivity based on various metrics
+   * @param {object} metrics - Team metrics data
+   * @returns {object} Productivity analysis
+   */
+  analyzeTeamProductivity(metrics) {
+    const {
+      commitsPerDay = 0,
+      linesOfCode = 0,
+      pullRequestsMerged = 0,
+      bugsFixed = 0,
+      featuresDelivered = 0,
+      codeReviewTime = 0
+    } = metrics;
+
+    let productivityScore = 2; // Base level
+
+    // Analyze commit frequency
+    if (commitsPerDay > 10) productivityScore += 2;
+    else if (commitsPerDay > 5) productivityScore += 1;
+    else if (commitsPerDay < 2) productivityScore -= 1;
+
+    // Factor in code quality indicators
+    if (pullRequestsMerged > 3) productivityScore += 1;
+    if (bugsFixed > 5) productivityScore += 1;
+    if (featuresDelivered > 2) productivityScore += 2;
+
+    // Code review efficiency
+    if (codeReviewTime < 2) productivityScore += 1; // Fast reviews
+    else if (codeReviewTime > 8) productivityScore -= 1; // Slow reviews
+
+    // Clamp score
+    productivityScore = Math.max(0, Math.min(5, productivityScore));
+    
+    const level = this.productivityLevels[productivityScore];
+    const analysis = this.generateProductivityInsight(productivityScore, metrics);
+    
+    this.recordMetrics(level, metrics, analysis);
+    
+    return {
+      level,
+      score: productivityScore,
+      analysis,
+      recommendations: this.getRecommendations(productivityScore)
+    };
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Generate productivity insight based on metrics
+   * @param {number} score - Productivity score
+   * @param {object} metrics - Raw metrics
+   * @returns {string} Insight message
+   */
+  generateProductivityInsight(score, metrics) {
+    const insights = {
+      0: `Team seems to be in planning mode. Low activity detected.`,
+      1: `Steady progress but room for improvement. Consider sprint planning review.`,
+      2: `Good baseline productivity. Team is maintaining consistent output.`,
+      3: `Strong performance! Team is delivering quality work efficiently.`,
+      4: `Excellent productivity! Team is in the zone with high-quality output.`,
+      5: `Outstanding performance! Team is operating at peak efficiency.`
+    };
+
+    let insight = insights[score];
+    
+    // Add specific observations
+    if (metrics.bugsFixed > metrics.featuresDelivered) {
+      insight += ` Focus on bug fixes suggests stabilization phase.`;
+    }
+    if (metrics.codeReviewTime > 6) {
+      insight += ` Code review bottleneck detected.`;
+    }
+    if (metrics.commitsPerDay > 15) {
+      insight += ` High commit frequency - ensure code quality isn't compromised.`;
+    }
+
+    return insight;
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Record team metrics in history
+   * @param {string} level - Productivity level emoji
+   * @param {object} metrics - Metrics data
+   * @param {string} analysis - Analysis text
+   */
+  recordMetrics(level, metrics, analysis) {
+    this.teamMetrics.push({
+      level,
+      metrics,
+      analysis,
+      timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
+      date: new Date().toDateString()
+    });
+
+    // Keep last 30 days
+    if (this.teamMetrics.length > 30) {
+      this.teamMetrics.shift();
+    }
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Get productivity recommendations
+   * @param {number} score - Current productivity score
+   * @returns {array} Array of recommendations
+   */
+  getRecommendations(score) {
+    const recommendations = {
+      0: [
+        'Schedule team sync to identify blockers',
+        'Review sprint goals and priorities',
+        'Consider pair programming sessions'
+      ],
+      1: [
+        'Implement daily standups if not already',
+        'Review and optimize development workflow',
+        'Identify and remove process bottlenecks'
+      ],
+      2: [
+        'Maintain current momentum',
+        'Consider code quality metrics tracking',
+        'Plan for upcoming sprint capacity'
+      ],
+      3: [
+        'Document successful practices for replication',
+        'Consider mentoring other teams',
+        'Explore automation opportunities'
+      ],
+      4: [
+        'Share best practices with organization',
+        'Consider taking on stretch goals',
+        'Invest in team skill development'
+      ],
+      5: [
+        'Maintain sustainable pace to avoid burnout',
+        'Lead innovation initiatives',
+        'Become productivity champions for other teams'
+      ]
+    };
+
+    return recommendations[score] || ['Keep up the great work!'];
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Generate weekly team report
+   * @returns {string} Formatted team report
+   */
+  generateWeeklyReport() {
+    if (this.teamMetrics.length === 0) {
+      return 'No team metrics available yet. Start tracking to see insights!';
+    }
+
+    const weeklyData = this.teamMetrics.slice(-7);
+    const avgScore = weeklyData.reduce((sum, day) => {
+      return sum + this.productivityLevels.indexOf(day.level);
+    }, 0) / weeklyData.length;
+
+    const currentLevel = this.productivityLevels[Math.round(avgScore)];
+    const trend = this.calculateTrend(weeklyData);
+
+    return `
+📊 Weekly Team Productivity Report
+==================================
+Current Level: ${currentLevel} (${this.getLevelName(currentLevel)})
+Weekly Trend: ${trend.direction} ${trend.emoji}
+Days Tracked: ${weeklyData.length}
+
+📈 Key Insights:
+${weeklyData.slice(-3).map(day => `• ${day.date}: ${day.level} - ${day.analysis}`).join('\n')}
+
+🎯 Focus Areas:
+${this.getRecommendations(Math.round(avgScore)).slice(0, 3).map(rec => `• ${rec}`).join('\n')}
+
+💡 Team Health Score: ${Math.round(avgScore * 20)}%
+    `.trim();
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Calculate productivity trend
+   * @param {array} data - Recent metrics data
+   * @returns {object} Trend information
+   */
+  calculateTrend(data) {
+    if (data.length < 2) return { direction: 'Stable', emoji: '➡️' };
+
+    const recent = data.slice(-3).map(d => this.productivityLevels.indexOf(d.level));
+    const older = data.slice(-6, -3).map(d => this.productivityLevels.indexOf(d.level));
+
+    const recentAvg = recent.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0) / recent.length;
+    const olderAvg = older.length > 0 ? older.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0) / older.length : recentAvg;
+
+    if (recentAvg > olderAvg + 0.5) return { direction: 'Improving', emoji: '📈' };
+    if (recentAvg < olderAvg - 0.5) return { direction: 'Declining', emoji: '📉' };
+    return { direction: 'Stable', emoji: '➡️' };
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Get human-readable level name
+   * @param {string} emoji - Level emoji
+   * @returns {string} Level name
+   */
+  getLevelName(emoji) {
+    const names = {
+      '🐌': 'Planning Phase',
+      '🚶': 'Steady Progress',
+      '🏃': 'Good Momentum',
+      '🚀': 'High Performance',
+      '⚡': 'Peak Efficiency',
+      '🔥': 'Exceptional Output'
+    };
+    return names[emoji] || 'Unknown';
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Get team productivity insights for stakeholders
+   * @returns {object} Executive summary
+   */
+  getExecutiveSummary() {
+    const recentMetrics = this.teamMetrics.slice(-7);
+    if (recentMetrics.length === 0) {
+      return { status: 'No data available' };
+    }
+
+    const avgProductivity = recentMetrics.reduce((sum, day) => {
+      return sum + this.productivityLevels.indexOf(day.level);
+    }, 0) / recentMetrics.length;
+
+    const healthScore = Math.round(avgProductivity * 20);
+    const status = healthScore > 80 ? 'Excellent' : healthScore > 60 ? 'Good' : healthScore > 40 ? 'Fair' : 'Needs Attention';
+
+    return {
+      status,
+      healthScore,
+      currentLevel: this.productivityLevels[Math.round(avgProductivity)],
+      keyMetrics: {
+        averageCommitsPerDay: Math.round(recentMetrics.reduce((sum, d) => sum + (d.metrics.commitsPerDay || 0), 0) / recentMetrics.length),
+        averagePRsMerged: Math.round(recentMetrics.reduce((sum, d) => sum + (d.metrics.pullRequestsMerged || 0), 0) / recentMetrics.length),
+        averageReviewTime: Math.round(recentMetrics.reduce((sum, d) => sum + (d.metrics.codeReviewTime || 0), 0) / recentMetrics.length)
+      },
+      recommendations: this.getRecommendations(Math.round(avgProductivity)).slice(0, 2)
+    };
+  }
+}
+
+module.exports = TeamProductivityAnalyzer;

ai.title: feat(experimental): Add DeveloperMoodTracker and TeamProductivityAnalyzer for enhanced insights
ai.body:
This PR introduces two experimental features to enhance project insights:

1. **DeveloperMoodTracker:** This class analyzes commit messages and code changes to gauge developer mood.  It considers keywords like 'fix', 'feat', 'refactor', and the number of lines/files changed to assign a mood emoji (😴, 😤, 🤔, 😊, 🚀, 🔥). It maintains a mood history, calculates the dominant mood over the last 5 commits, and generates a report suitable for team standups.  This is experimental and could benefit from more sophisticated sentiment analysis.

2. **TeamProductivityAnalyzer:** This class analyzes team productivity based on several metrics (commits per day, lines of code, merged PRs, bugs fixed, features delivered, code review time). It calculates a productivity score (0-5), assigns a productivity level emoji (🐌, 🚶, 🏃, 🚀, ⚡, 🔥), and generates insights.  It also produces a weekly report for the team and an executive summary for stakeholders.  This could be expanded to include more metrics.

Both features are experimental and subject to improvement.  The `TeamProductivityAnalyzer` uses a simple scoring system, and more robust algorithms could be added for higher accuracy.  The `DeveloperMoodTracker` uses basic keyword analysis; more sophisticated natural language processing (NLP) techniques could be incorporated.
ai.summary: This PR adds experimental features to track developer mood and analyze team productivity, providing valuable insights for both developers and project managers.
